The workspace I work on has 7 projects 3 of which are aspectj project.
Typically I never saw this error, eventually adding more aspects and more inpath entries I started to see it more and more often.
I can start eclipse with more heap size, but the root cause of the problem seems to be related to the aspectj compiler.
Reported is the error I get:

java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
at java.nio.HeapByteBuffer.<init>(Unknown Source)
at java.nio.ByteBuffer.allocate(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder$CharsetSE.<init>(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder$CharsetSE.<init>(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder$CharsetSE.<init>(Unknown Source)
at sun.nio.cs.StreamEncoder.forOutputStreamWriter(Unknown Source)
at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.<init>(Unknown Source)
at java.io ... va:107)
at org.aspectj.ajde.internal.AspectJBuildManager$CompilerThread.run(AspectJBuildManager.java:191)

OutOfMemoryError thrown: Java heap space

If you are on AspectJ 1.5.0 then you need to upgrade.  Version 1.5.3 has pipeline compilation which uses far less memory for compilation.  However, you might have meant AJDT 1.5.0 (which already includes 1.5.3 + a few more fixes) in which case can I ask what Xmx value you use to run eclipse? we typically recommend at least 512M
